availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick William Krueskamp (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, liquor store owner)

body.p: Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, liquor store owner. Native of Hanover. Son of William Krueskamp and Allice Krueskamp. Married to Amelia Krueskamp. Father of John Krueskamp, William Kruekmp, Frederick Krueskamp, Henry Krueskamp, Emma Krueskamp. Owned and operated liquor store at Craig Street and Lexington Pike in Covington, Kenton County, in 1860. Employed Edward Markwoot and Catherine Helmich in Kenton County in 1860.
